intro: Biarum spruneri, commonly known as the dwarf white trillium, is a delicate flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its three heart-shaped leaves and a single white flower with three petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodlands and thrives in cool, humid climates. Biarum spruneri is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Trilliaceae family.
